result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale L. Purdy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning 30 days after release from custody.

The jail sentence shall begin immediately.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor County Case No. 16CM111.
Consecutive to: Taylor County Case No. 17CF45

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dale L. Purdy in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Dale L. Purdy in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Statement by Attorney Nocco.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; 90 days county jail concurrent to 16CM111 but consecutive to 17CF45.   The costs are due at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning 30 days after release from custody.  - rt

DAR started at 2:37:14. Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dale L. Purdy appeared in court with his Attorney Alec Nocco.  State requested a $500.00 signature bond with conditions of: booking. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Defendant waived further reading of the complaint; entered a plea of not guilty and requested a PTC. Court set Pre-trial conference for December 1, 2016 at 11:00 a.m. DAR stopped at 2:39:30. ba
Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Dale L. Purdy not in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  It is now 1:45 pm.  Court informed defendant this morning when he was in court that he had to be back to court this afternoon at 1:00 p.m.   Court does not issue a warrant in this case as he was not served with the complaint.  The court did issue a body only warrant in 16CM111.    - rt
